fields.summary: contact-details macro
Be able to render a link to a user property (e.g. email) rather than user's profile

fields.description: Relates to JRA-6354: In a corporate env, you want to be able to attach/display extra information about a user: e.g Phone Number, Geographical Location, etc. At the simplest level, they are what we (and I guess most corp users) would need. However, to cater for different requirements, maybe you want to be able to add custom properties to a user. Other Details: You may want to mark whether these fields are required or optional These fields must appear on the "Add New User" form. You need to be able to map these fields to external user management (e.g. Jira). You want to be able refer to these custom fields ala email [~cmiller:email] (renders an Charles Miller) or phone him on [~cmiller:phone]. You could then do useful stuff like {contact-details} macros : {contact-details:group=moo-developers|contact-details=fullname;email;phone;location} Which would render a table with the contact details. We have lots of people building this information by hand with || table || primitives...
fields.summary: Custom User Properties

fields.description: Adding watches is nice feature, but I would like to have in the notification mail only changes and not the whole page content. Now I have to always go to see what changes has been made. Probably feature should be configurable per watch.
fields.summary: "Page Edited" mail should have only page changes instead of whole content

fields.summary: Device out of space error is being hidden...

fields.description:
All our spaces have anonymous view permissions.

Yet, via the soap api, we dont see some spaces (whereas we should see all).
We only see spaces where our group membership gives us view permissions.

Basically, it looks like the SOAP api isnt taking the anonymous permissions into account...
fields.summary: SOAP API - cant see spaces that have anonymous view permission

Like the include macro except for mail.

The "new" Confluence site is currently half complete.

There's still quite a bit of work to do before the site properly represents the 1.4 release.

fields.description:
The release process should 

- build plugins for everything under src/etc/plugins . It's currently only building src/etc/plugins/macros . See project.properties and maven.xml (ask Nick). It would be saner to concentrate all plugins beneath one directory.

- a build.xml file is responsible for building plugins in the standalone. It's currently either missing or broken. It used to work. Look at an older standalone of Confluence (1.3) and compare it to the current for clarification.
fields.summary: Fix release process

fields.description:
Make a list of added features since 1.3 and ensure that each of them are documented at C.A.C..

Each feature should have its own page.

Try to build such documentation in the context of the user, admin, and developer guides.

This will not solve the documentation problem but will improve the ghetto.
fields.summary: Improve Conf. Documentation

Take a step back and consider what users want to discover in their email notifications. 

Notif.s should link to user's profile - manage notifications.

Fix comment email notif..

fields.description: I use the excerpt of child pages to annotate the {children} listing, but if the hierarchy is more than one level deep, I can't see enough detail of the tree to see which branches are important (have many children of their own). If I could use the excerpt parameter and the depth/all parameters together, I could make the children listing much more useful.
fields.summary: Allow excerpt and depth/all parameters to work together in children macro
Children count macro

Thanks,

Helves

fields.description: We've recently refactored the event hierachy and added generic superclasses to group events (SecurityEvent, AttachmentEvent, etc.). The child classes still contain duplicated code (e.g. getSessionId() is in LoginEvent and LogoutEvent, both children of SecurityEvent). Use inheritance!
fields.summary: Refactor event hierachy to avoid repetition of code in child classes

fields.description:
The way we store attachments is broken, and causes a lot of unnecessary bugs - case issues, accented characters, etc. etc.

Attachments should be stored on the filesystem as $HOME/attachments/[contentId]/[attachmentId] - all filename <=> attachmentId <=> currentVersion transformations should be performed by the application.
fields.summary: Attachments unreliable due to file-names

fields.description: Use the ServletRequest API to add remote ip and hostname of the user logging in or out.
fields.summary: Add remoteIP and remoteHost info to SecurityEvent

fields.summary: Resources should be backed up (logos - spatial and global)

fields.description:
When a search is limited by space, we need some text up the top similar to the current warning about mail:

You are searching the Foo space. 12345 matches were found in all spaces, click here to include them.

Or something like that.
fields.summary: Quick link to "search in all spaces" on a space-limited search

fields.summary: attachments macro

An apparent regression of CONF-2668.

- When I click on "Preview" the parent page is gone.
- When I click on "Add" and there are invalid characters, the parent page is gone.
fields.summary: Parent page blanking out (regression)

fields.description: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Linking+In+Confluence?focusedCommentId=9497#comment-9497
fields.summary: Weird unrendered comments

fields.description:
Plugins (and plugin modules) should be able to specify a help .vm file.

If a plugin or module has a help file, then a (?) is rendered appropriately in the admin UI.

If a macro plugin already has notataion help, then the help should fall back to this, but there should be the option to have separate admin help and notation help.
fields.summary: Allow plugins to specify help text

fields.description: Need to backup any uploaded plugins.
fields.summary: Back up plugins directory
Refactoring doesn't change pages when they're in a macro

fields.description: Currently, only the "url" parameter of the JUnitReportMacro is documented. We should also doc. the report and reportdetail params.
fields.summary: Document all junitreport options
junitreport macro needs to work on <testsuites>

fields.description: Email notifications of new comments contain the text of the page. Shouldn't they contain the text of the comment instead? :)
fields.summary: New comment notifications don't contain the new comment

fields.description:
The release downloads have a custommacros directory but no plugins directory!

Plugins aren't being included in the released files at all.
fields.summary: No buildable plugins in 1.4DR6 releases!

fields.description:
In one case I would like to present an easy link for people to edit a pages which are summarized in a table. Currently, I can either provide a plain link (and the user then has to follow the link, then click Edit Page), or I have to copy the URL from the Edit Page link on the page, and use a masking link [like this|http://] to make the link readable.

It would be nice if there was an easy way to link to the edit page directly. Such as [SomePage|edit=true] or {edit:Some Page} or something like that.
fields.summary: Simple way to link to an edit page

fields.description: It would be nice to be able to have multiple excerpts on a page, each with a different name, so that you could excerpt-include different portions of the page for different reasons. E.g. You might want to excerpt the first paragraph, or some sort of 'status' text, or some table. The default excerpt would have no name, and would work as it now does.
fields.summary: Named excerpts

fields.description: Would be nice to be able to copy a page. This would bring you to the Add Page screen, but the Title, Content, and Parent Page would be copied from the original page. The cursor should be in the Title, possibly with the title text selected if that's possible, indicating that the user should change the title to something different. It's good to copy the title text initially since the new page is likely to have a similar name.
fields.summary: Copy page

fields.description:
I renamed a page, and all the normal \[ \] style links got updated, but not the links in the \{excerpt-include\} macros. Instead the excerpt-include macro displays as "The page Some Page does not exist."

Since I'm using excerpt-include a lot, and I want to be able to easily change page names (I'm using it to track acceptance tests), this will be very annoying for me, requiring a lot of extra hand maintenance.
fields.summary: Rename page doesn't update \{excerpt-include\} links

fields.description:
I have tested this in the latest DR6 for 1.4 as well as the shipping 1.3.5. Repro's the same.

Take the following text and put it on a Conf page...

<<<

h1. Heading 1
* Bullet
h2. Heading 2...indented??
h2. Heading 2...still indented??

h2. Heading 2...ok not indented now

>>>

The bullet item should not cause either heading below it to get indented, should it? Adding a blank line works around the problem. See screen shot for the results.
fields.summary: Rendering bug - indentations caused by bullet points

fields.description: It should display inherited permissions as well as link to the pages those permissions are inherited from.
fields.summary: Page Info screen does not display inherited restrictions

fields.description:
e.g. 

| @VAR|list(one,two,three,four)@ |

The inner pipe is treated as a cell separator.
fields.summary: Template entry params can confuse tables.

fields.description: The page level permissions options only appear on edit, not create. Bit of an oversight there I think.
fields.summary: Put permissions UI on "Create page" page

fields.description:
If you are watching a space, the "watch page" interface element doesn't display. There is no way of knowing the reason it's not displaying, it just looks like the functionality is MIA.

I'm not sure how to fix this elegantly, though.
fields.summary: Watch page UI confusing if you are watching a space

fields.description: On a page called "My page", the macro {anchor:foo-bar} creates the HTML But the link [My page#foo-bar] generates a link to http://servername/confluence/display/MYSPACE/My+page#Mypage-foo-bar which is invalid because of the extra '-'. Casual testing suggests that this can be replicated with other non-alphanumeric characters. Some of these characters may be legal for anchor names.
fields.summary: Handling of '-' in anchor macro and links

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-2917].
  {panel}

We would find it quite useful to be able to have more flexibility with comments. Currently, once a comment is added to a page, it is either stuck there or can be deleted. 

What we are finding is:
1) some pages become popular and attract long threads of comments- often diverging in to multiple topics
2) some users just don't "get" Confluence, and so when they're trying to add some information, they whack it in a comment on the closest available page (even though it might have nothing to do with what they are commenting about)
3) Project managers need to troll pages to make sure that this isn't getting out of hand, and create new applicable pages, and then cutting and pasting comments in to appropriate pages


To solve this, it would be really nice (in order of usefulness)
a) move comments from one page to another
b) be able to move threads of comments to another page
c) have more flexibility with entry types, so a comment can be transformed to a page or news posting
fields.summary: Move comments, making comments into a page

fields.description: Interestingly enough, it will tell you if there are matches in mail, and then if you click on "include these matches" you'll still get nothing back.
fields.summary: Searching anonymously brings back no results

fields.description: Currently, when you unzip Confluence, the directory is called 'confluence'.  However, it would be better if the directory was called 'confluence-<version>'.  This would allow you to unzip multiple versions in the same directory.
fields.summary: Confluence's directory structure is not versioned

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-2914].
  {panel}

Requesting and opening a PDF in Confluence can be vastly inefficient due to this bug in IE: 

http://raibledesigns.com/page/rd/20050323#how_ie_handles_pdfs
http://support.microsoft.com/default.aspx?scid=kb;EN-US;q293792

We need to handle this with a servlet filter (as described in the first link) to prevent large pdf exports from being sent across the wire needlessly.
fields.summary: Write servlet filter to handle redundant requests sent when opening a PDF document in Internet Explorer

fields.description:
This is a somewhat small feature I'd like to see implemented in the "News
Post" feature: the ability to assign one or more categories to a post.
Currently, there's no simple way to differentiate the type of content that
appears on a news post.

I'm not interested in any Technorati, Flickr, or del.icio.us "tags", which
are more free form for the poster. Just an option on the posting to check
off one or more categories/subcategories that a space admin sets up in
advance.

This feature would also be available as a option to pass into the
{blog-posts} macro, so you can return relevant content.
fields.summary: Categorizing a news post

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-2911].
  {panel}

It would be great for administrators to be able to send an email to a group, list of groups, or list of users. Similar to the mail page functionality (CONF-1062), except that you might want to email a short message to a group of Confluence users that isn't on a page anywhere.

Specifically:

- form should be accessible only by site admins
- ability to select one or more Confluence users or groups to send email to
- text field to enter email body
- send email using Confluence's configured mail server.

Some nice-to-haves:

- save templates and select a specific template to send
- enable reply to email (need to managed replies in diff system)
- keep record of emails sent. to group, date sent and copy of email text.
fields.summary: Ability to send email to Confluence user group

fields.description:
It seems the refactoring of the UI state stuff has broken the UI state.

Steps to reproduce:

# log in to http://confluence.atlassian.com/
# Expand the recent changes list to 20 
# Click on the Confluence logo to reload the Dashboard

Expected:

* Recent changes list will be 20 items long

Actual:

* Recent changes list has returned to being 10 items long
fields.summary: Regression: Recent Changes expansion state no longer remembered

fields.description:
I want to use this to display a list of internal build/test environments. Sometimes these are on an old old build, and sometimes they're shut down while a build is being loaded.

If I use html-include, I get "Error rendering macro: null" when the webserver is down, and when the referenced page doesn't exist, I get the contents of the webserver's 404 error.

What I'd like to be able to do is display "notfound" and "unavailable" arguments to the macro, e.g.
{html-include:url=http://todd-viegut:7001/profinia/AppInfo|notfound=old build|unavailable=site down}
fields.summary: No error handling in {html-include} macro if content is unavailable, not found or has the wrong content-type

fields.description:

org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getExcludedMailCount' in class com.atlassian.confluence.pages.actions.SearchViewListPagesAction threw exception class java.lang.NullPointerException : null

Furthermore the mails are not ordered by date. This makes finding a mail a tough job. It would be nice if someone could fix this asap.
fields.summary: Searching the mail archive doesn't work

fields.description:
In DR5 we all options went missing.

In DR5a everything but Change Space Logo has gone missing.

Acceptance tests should have picked up the DR5 problem (we have a CustomizeLogoAcceptanceTest).

Fix and ensure that UATs are okay.
fields.summary: Space look and feel options in space admin broken
Automatic redirection for renamed pages

fields.description:
We need to improve the performance & quality of Confluence. 

From a quick glance at an installation on Oracle 

select count(*) from user_indexes where  table_name='CONTENT' it appears that we only create two indices on the CONTENT table!

This is not optimal - we cater for around 5 content types in the content table (at least) so something is running more slowly than it should. 

Confirm if this is accurate. Plan indexing on CONTENT (and other central tables) to improve performance.
fields.summary: investigate current indexes created on content table in Confluence

fields.description:
If you have a Wiki page devoted to people uploading screenshots or photos of some event, the Dashboard "recently updated" space will not include a notification of a new attachment.  This means people need to remember to visit such pages themselves.  I think a new attachment should be considered a modification/update and appear accordingly in the various notifications.

In the case of the Dashboard, maybe you could include the comment, if one was provided, for the attachment.
fields.summary: Recently updated feeds should include new attachments

h2. Details


h3. VAX / Cognos Reconciliation 

XXXX was due to create a reconciliation process which produced a text file that we could use to automatically
reconcile the data in the daily cube. This file is just a reformatting of the standard report which could also be used (if it were stripped of extraneous data). The files are located in the following directory on the VAX - COGNOS:
{code} shopli/att_kpi_yymmddw.txt {code}

h3. Productionised Decision Stream tasks

There was a need to review timing and robustness of tasks to ensure that they were available in the appropriate timeframes for BK usage.

h3. Validation of Data

Based on VAX output validate that the data contained in the cubes was complete and accurate.
fields.summary: Page cause update to hang

fields.description:
Currently you cannot manipulate comments through the remote API.

I suggest we add methods to:
- add comment
- remove comment
- retrieve single comment (by ID)

Also, the Comment struct itself needs to be modified to include a "parent" field as then we can reconstruct the comment tree remotely if needed.
fields.summary: Comment manipulation methods

I just got a notification saying that I'd edited a page, but I have never edited that page.

> Page Edited : JIRA : Editing the work log
> Editing the work log has been edited by Mike Cannon-Brookes (Mar 20, 2005). 

This is v. bad and must be fixed before we ship.

Also, the "View changes" link is broken in the HTML email notifications:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/diffpagesbyversion.action?pageId=117639&originalVersion=0&revisedVersion=1
fields.summary: Notifications list incorrect editors

fields.description:
Notwithstanding the comment in CONF-2779 (XMLRPC clients are expected to do their own validation)

If I create a space using the XMLRPC interface with an invalid space key of CRAZY-SPACE, the space is still created.  If I know the page names etc, then I can go and view those pages, however there are big chunks of functionality that don't work.  Looking through the log, errors of  the following type occur:

14:15:52,704 DEBUG [SimpleDisplayServlet] Failed to parse path /CRAZY-SPACE
 java.text.ParseException: Simple path: CRAZY-SPACE could not be translated
       at com.atlassian.confluence.servlet.simpledisplay.SimpleDisplayServlet.parsePath(SimpleDisplayServlet.java:89)
       at com.atlassian.confluence.servlet.simpledisplay.SimpleDisplayServlet.doGet(SimpleDisplayServlet.java:42)
       at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:740)
       at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:853)
       at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHolder.handle(ServletHolder.java:358)
...

It would seem to me, that in the best interests of overall Confluence health, an invalid space should not really be creatable via XML-RPC or any other interface.

This is not a showstopper, or even really a "bug" if you consider the XMLRPC interface to be an admin only interface that lets you do dumb things.  It's just something worth considering.
fields.summary: XMLRPC interfaces allow creation of invalid spaces

fields.description:
Using Version 1.3.5 Build 122
In issue CONF:660 it was reported that after a page was locked other users were still able to edit it, but that this bug was fixed in version 1.1
This still seems to be a problem. Once a page is locked, other users are aware that the page has been locked and for what reason, but they are still presented with an edit window and and update button, and they still work.
fields.summary: Lock Page fails to present editing by other users
